name: Jackals
background:
Jackals are species of aliens who resemble humanoid canids, and use technology built from salvaged scrap. Without access to advanced weapons or vehicles, they rely on ambush and ferocity in close combat to win. 

In the beginning, they were a collection of nomadic tribes until they discovered the wreckage of alien ships on their planet. Soon after, they made contact with the other species of Sirius, and were suddenly thrust from tribal hunters into the space age. Now the Jackals’ way of life has been forever changed, as they have begun to migrate to the stars.
backgroundFull:
The Jackals’ home world was long left uncharted due to the unique properties of their home system’s sun. Radiation from their sun reflected from the atmosphere interfered with the electronic scanners of vessels passing nearby. At a distance, it caused the scanners to detect large stores of rare elements which are used to stabilize wormholes, but ships approaching closer have their scanners and electronic systems short out completely. This has resulted in a graveyard of ships floating above the Jackals’ home world, which occasionally fall out of orbit onto the planet’s surface.

The Jackals were, until recently, made up of tribes of hunter-gatherers who migrated from oasis to oasis after their prey. This changed when the Jackals began to discover wrecked ships on their home world. The first ships were from the Robot Legion, whose pilots had been deactivated along with their ships. These wrecks gradually became a network of trading posts and cities for the wandering Jackals, and the weapons and technology contained within were salvaged and traded. The Jackals began to chase falling ships, hoping to get to the salvage first.

Eventually, the Jackals began to meet and save survivors. These survivors were taken in with the tribes, and taught the Jackals about the wider galaxy. Eventually, jump gates were established on the planet, allowing safe travel to and from their world. Jackals began working with outsiders, who valued their survival skills, tenacity and inventiveness for use as scouts and mercenaries. Many Jackals view travelling off world as a continuation of their traditional nomadic life-style.

While some might view the Jackals as backward for their traditions, these traditions have proven adaptable and continue to unite them even as they spread through the sector. The Jackals have proven their ability to quickly adapt both new ideas and technologies into their way of life, but only time will tell whether their culture will survive the shock of galactic life. 

How will you find your way among the stars?

spells.name: Psy-Hunter
spells.effect: Pick one friendly unit within 12", which gets Scrapper Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Power Maw
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 12", which take 1 hit with AP(2) each.

spells.name: Mind Shaper
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 18", which get -1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? this.getMoraleCost({ ...unit, quality: Math.max(1, unit.quality - params.effect.rollModifier.value) }) - this.getMoraleCost(unit) : 0

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: params.thisUnit ? 0 : this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 - params.effect.rollModifier.value }) - this.getMoraleCost({ quality: 5 })

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Quill Blast
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 12", which takes 4 hits with Scratch.

spells.name: Power Field
spells.effect: Pick up to three friendly units within 12", which get Shielded once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Feral Strike
spells.effect: Pick one enemy unit within 6", which takes 3 hits with AP(2) and Deadly(3).

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Scrapper
specialRules.description: When attacking, targets must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6 when blocking hits from this model's weapons.

specialRules.name: Precise
specialRules.description: Gets +1 to hit when attacking.

specialRules.name: Unique
specialRules.description: This unit may only be taken once per army.

specialRules.name: Destructive
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, those hits get AP(+4).

specialRules.name: Crossing Strike
specialRules.description: Once per game, once during its activation when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them, and roll X dice. For each 4+ it takes 3 hits with AP(1).

specialRules.name: Repel Ambushers
specialRules.description: Enemy units using Ambush must be set up over 12" away from this model's unit.

specialRules.name: Surprise Piercing Shot
specialRules.description: Counts as having Ambush, and gets AP(+2) when shooting on the round in which it deploys via this rule.

specialRules.name: Crossing Attack
specialRules.description: Once per activation, when this model moves through enemy units, pick one of them and roll X dice. For each 6+ it takes 1 hit.

specialRules.name: Precision Fighter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get +1 to hit rolls in melee.

specialRules.name: Melee Evasion
specialRules.description: Enemies get -1 to hit rolls in melee when attacking units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Scrapper Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Scrapper Boost.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Unpredictable Shooter.

specialRules.name: Scout Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Scout.

specialRules.name: Scratch
specialRules.description: Against units where most models have Tough(3) to Tough(9), this weapon gets AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Bounding
specialRules.description: When this unit is activated, you may place all models with this rule in it anywhere fully within D3+1" of their position.

specialRules.name: Ranged Shrouding Aura
specialRules.description: This model and its unit get Ranged Shrouding.

specialRules.name: Surge
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 6 to hit, this weapon deals 1 extra hits (only the original hit counts as a 6 for special rules).

specialRules.name: Morale Debuff
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick one enemy unit within 18", which gets -1 to morale test rolls once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Precision Tag
specialRules.description: Once per game, during this model's activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of it, and place X markers on it. When attacking, friendly units may remove markers from their target before rolling to hit to get +Y to hit rolls, where Y is the number of removed markers.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration in Melee
specialRules.description: This model gets Ignores Regeneration in melee.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Scrapper Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Scrapper, enemies taking hits from it must re-roll successful unmodified defense results of 5-6 from Scrapper (instead of only on 6).

specialRules.name: Unpredictable
specialRules.description: When attacking, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Unpredictable Shooter
specialRules.description: When shooting, roll one die and apply one effect to all models with this rule: on a 1-3 they get AP(+1), and on a 4-6 they get +1 to hit rolls instead.

specialRules.name: Scout
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. After all other units are deployed, may be deployed anywhere fully within 12” of their deployment zone. Players alternate in placing Scout units, starting with the player that activates next.

specialRules.name: Tough
specialRules.description: This model must take X wounds before being killed. If a model with tough joins a unit without it, then it is removed last when the unit takes wounds. You must continue to put wounds on the tough model with most wounds in the unit until it is killed, before starting to put them on the next tough model (heroes must be assigned wounds last, even if already wounded).

specialRules.name: Ranged Shrouding
specialRules.description: Enemies get -6" range when trying to shoot units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Regeneration
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule takes wounds, roll one die for each. On a 5+ it is ignored.

specialRules.name: Ignores Regeneration
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores Regeneration.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Deadly
specialRules.description: Assign each wound to one model, and multiply it by X. Hits from Deadly must be resolved first, and these wounds don’t carry over to other models if the original target is killed.
